articles.title: CFPB sues JPMorgan Chase, Bank of America and Wells Fargo over Zelle payment fraud - CNBC
articles.description: Zelle, a peer-to-peer payments network run by bank-owned fintech firm Early Warning Services, allows for instant payments to other consumers and businesses.
articles.content: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau on Friday sued the operator of the Zelle payments network and the three U.S. banks that dominant transactions on it, alleging that the firms failed to properl… [+1850 chars]

articles.author: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
articles.title: Why Apple sends spyware victims to this nonprofit security lab - TechCrunch
articles.description: Cybersecurity experts, who work with human rights defenders and journalists, agree that Apple is doing the right thing by sending notifications to victims of mercenary spyware — and at the same time refusing to forensically analyze the devices.
